results.title: The Long pain
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “W5”.
W5 is a Canadian television public affairs program. This episode deals with arthritis management and pain associated with the disease including younger sufferers.

results.title: All in the family
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “W5”.
Documentary highlighting the value of family therapy. Shows scenes in a controlled therapy session where a girl’s problems are discussed with her family. Discusses certain illnesses such as anorexia nervosa and the approach for dealing with this disease showing the progression of the therapy sessions. No other credits available.

results.title: Four minutes to live
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “W5”.
Presented by Jim Reed, this episode of a weekly television public affairs series focusses on emergency-response healthcare. Subjects include: the need for paramedics in Ontario; Vancouver, Calgary, and Medicine Hat as the only places in Canada with advanced pre-paramedical training and personnel; and patients who have been saved by CPR.

results.title: Dying to be thin
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “W5”.
An examination of the slimmer’s desease, anorexia nervosa. Through interviews with those who have, or have had the disorder, examines the psychological and societal pressures which induce young women to diet to the point of starvation.

results.title: Who shall ease the pain?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “W5”.
This film argues the case that there is no need for cancer sufferers to die in pain. The triumvirate of drugs cocaine, heroin and marijuana alone or a mixture combination may be recommended to ease pain. The illicit use of these drugs has detracted the possibilities of their potential to be put to good use. One man alone in the USA has medical and legal prescriptions for 10 marijuana cigarettes per day to prevent blindness.

results.title: Man who bypassed death
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “W5”.
Follows John Duffy through open heart surgery. Without the surgery he would have died within the year. The multiple by-pass operation now-a-days has a low failure rate, but it is still a frightening experience. Duffy and his doctor share their doubts and fears through each stage in the procedure.

results.title: Fiona Hall. After 200 years
results.creator_credit: Kevin Ballantine, Brian Beaton and Izon Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Visual instincts : Australian contemporary photographers”.
Two 30 minute episodes: 1. “Fiona Hall” Interview with Adelaide photographic artist, Fiona Hall. She discusses the aims and symbolism of her photo-collages and wide format photography. 2. “After 200 Years” A program on the Bicentennial project, co-ordinated by Penny Taylor, to commission twenty Australian photographers to document the diversity of Australian Aboriginal and Islander lifestyles in the ‘80s.
